title: ABC Classification Changed Event
description: Published when a SKU's ABC classification changes based on inventory analysis. ABC classification uses Pareto principle (80/20 rule) to categorize inventory: Class A items (top 20% by value, 80% of revenue), Class B (middle 30%), Class C (bottom 50%). This classification drives inventory policies including safety stock levels, reorder points, cycle count frequencies, and storage location assignments.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit identifier - the unique product code being reclassified

previous_class.description: Previous ABC classification before the change. Null for initial classification of new SKUs. Used to track classification trends and identify items moving up or down in importance.

new_class.description: New ABC classification after analysis. Class A: High-value/high-priority items requiring tight control. Class B: Medium-importance items. Class C: Low-value items with relaxed control.

criteria.description: Classification methodology used. VALUE_BASED: Annual dollar usage. VELOCITY_BASED: Unit turnover rate. CRITICALITY_BASED: Business impact score. COMBINED: Weighted combination of multiple factors.

reason.description: Human-readable explanation for the classification change, supporting audit trail and business understanding
reason.example: Annual reclassification: SKU moved to Class A due to 150% increase in sales velocity
